sections.title: Brief
sections.text: Design Solution for EPA's air quality challenge to engage communities in monitoring air quality data and taking action to improve their environment. The challenge : 1. Manage the data they collect Create solutions and identify best practices 2. Plan to share data with other communities 3. Engage citizens in collecting data about their community. Link to Prototype

images.text: We started off by understanding the problem statement and followed divergent and then convergent steps to design our prototype

We came up with three personas:
  • The Tech guy who is all concerned about air quality and takes part in activities concerning air quality.
  • Second is of a soccer mom who doesnt have much time to act about air quality but she is concerned about the air quality of the places her children visit.
  • The Third is of a student who wants to research about air quality and the various factors that affect it for his school project.
We conducted Google Surveys to know more about the type of users we are dealing with and their concerns about air quality

As you can see the primary problem that people had regarding air quality improvement activities was the time effort required. We treated this as priority and acted upon designing an app that wouldnt take up too much user time.
Some of the prototypes that we designed based ont he personas we had come up with

The final screen with all the informational components placed. All the information that the user wants is available to him/her in the first view. Secondary information such as chart details and breakup of air quality score and information about pollutants and sensors appears when you drill down from the home screen.

sections.title: Brief
sections.text: The CMYK Designathon is an annual one-day design competion for UC Berkeley students; this year’s contest challenged participants to transform the brand of a local business: community stalwart Games of Berkeley. Games of Berkeley is one of the oldest tabletop game stores in the Bay Area. After three decades in downtown Berkeley, the store planned to move to a new location closer to the Cal campus, and was seeking marketing strategies to attract new customers while keeping old ones. In particular, the store wanted to brand itself as community hangout, with a gathering space and a full range of gaming events.We designed a marketing campaign that included posters, folded-paper “fortune-teller”, and deck of playing cards to help transform the brand of the store. Our design targeted Cal students as the primary user group.We won the First-place prize and “Illustration Wizard” award for the best-quality designs, 2016 CMYK Designathon, UC Berkeley.My Team included others from the Ischool,UC Berkeley: Yifei Liu, Safei Gu, Michelle Carney, Prateek Nadagouda, Liz Lee

images.text: We started off with jotting down the characteristics of a Berkeley student and what is special about Berkeley that could be represented in the designs. Quirky and Liberal are some of the terms we came up with and that was the theme for our design.
Persona for our designs

This and two images below are pics of one design solution that we proposed. We created a low fidelity prototype of a whimsical folded-paper “fortune-teller” with a variety of reasons that people should visit the new store.

We designed a pair of one-page posters that could be distributed around campus, with games or crossword puzzles to make them interactive. Solving the puzzles would give the user a promocode to UberEATS whenever they deliver to the new Games of Berkeley Address, encouraging students to stay longer and making this a 'Stay and Play' hangout spot.

We designed a Games of Berkeley–themed deck of playing cards with icons representating the variety of games and activities at Games of Berkeley, along with store’s new address on the back of the cards.
Image of work in progress ( not candid )
Image of work in progress ( not candid )
The team with all the awards and gifts we received !

sections.title: Brief
sections.text: I  explored  the  interesting  combination  of  visual  art  driven  music.  This  device,  Thread  Art  Synthesizer  allows  people  interacting with it to make the process of creating thread art a  joyful  activity.  This  involves  use  of  ultrasonic  sensors  in  order to capture the distance of threads from the sensors and mapping it to different layers in music. In this paper, I would be  analyzing  people’s  reaction  to  a  prototype.  Since  this  device  brings  in  a  new  form  of  interaction,  it  would  be  interesting  to  observe  the  adoptability  of  the  interaction  as  well as analyze the interaction from a usability perspective.

sections.title: Brief
sections.text: Wooplr is India's first fashion discovery app. Wooplr's fast growing community of shoppers of which 80% are women, share fashion inspirations and the latest trends on the go. The primary aim was to modify the existing product details page and make it more intuitive to the user.

images.text: I started off with jotting down the Informational components on the page. Then I ranked these points according to the priority in which a particular information holds value to the user.
I created wireframes on mobile device mockups to get a brief idea how things are going to look like.

The final screen with all the informational components placed. All the information that the user wants is available to him/her in the first view. Secondary information such as likes and related items appear as you scroll down.

sections.title: Brief
sections.text:
EFC Kitchens was found in 2001 by Nick Amiri who has almost two decades of experience in the industry. This is a family owned business, where quality and excellence make the difference completing any project. Our attention to detail and our love for the trade quickly established us as a favorite amongst many high end home builders. In the past decade we have completed thousands of projects across the GTA, each one uniquely designed and built for the home owner. Great design is the first step to beautifully functional cabinetry. Equally important is the use of premium material, construction method and craftsmanship. At EFC Kitchens all of our cabinetry is completely custom made utilizing only the finest material and the greatest attention to detail. Industry leading European hardware manufacturers such as Blum, Hafele, and Grass are used in all of our cabinetry.
The primary aim of this project was to redesign the website for EFC Kitchens. Earlier their website was a multi page application. Being a pure informational website, I thought to make a single page application out of it.

images.text: The website required a brownish elegant colour to it, something that would match the colour of wood hence the theme for the website has been chosen that way. The gallery control is a hybrid of a carousel and an accordion. This is used to display images as well as categorize the gallery.

sections.title: Brief
sections.text: We have created a new product that will help designers, developers and program managers create web apps quick and easy to suit their needs. Just select your components, add to the package, select supported framework, apply theme and download! Elements is a Self Service User Interface, which means one would not require extensive help from UX Specialists for their needs. This would reduce the engagement time required by the user with the UX team and the efforts would be greatly minimized.Elements contains web components which can easily be integrated into almost any design. All the components cater to same family of visual design, and thus can be seamlessly integrated into projects, allowing you to create multiple apps. This leads to a drastic save in time and effort. We currently support 27 components ranging from headers, footers to form controls and alerts. These components are heavily modularized so that they can be used as plug n play in multiple configurations to ensure a smooth operation.
